required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Yogurts Supplemented With Mobilee on Joint Function in Healthy Individuals With Joint Discomfort
clinical_study.official_title: Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Nutrition Intervention Trial, to Study Efficacy and Safety of Yogurts Supplemented With Mobilee on Joint Function, Joint Structure and Quality of Life of Adults With Low Intensity Gonalgia

collaborator.agency: Technological Centre of Nutrition and Health

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine whether the daily eating of a yogurt supplemented with Mobile is effective in improving joint function and quality of life of individuals with low intensity gonalgia.

detailed_description.textblock: The prevalence of low intensity gonalgia is relatively high in western population. The purpose of the present intervention study is to determine whether the daily consumption of a yogurt supplemented with Mobile is effective in improving joint function and quality of life of individuals with low intensity gonalgia. Previous research using in vitro and animal models have demonstrated the efficacy of Mobilee in reducing inflammation and promoting anabolic responses in joint tissues. In addition, in two previous human intervention trials, the effects of Mobilee in joint function had been assessed using isokinetic tests. The present trial aims to confirm those previous results.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in isokineic assessment of muscular strength
primary_outcome.description: The muscular isokinetic assessment determines peak torque, power mean and total work of a certain joint using a dynamometric computerized system. The principal parameter is the change from baseline in the peak torque of the affected joint in extension at a speed of 240º/sec measured in Nm (Newton-meter).

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in isokinetic assessment of muscular strength (other conditions)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline of peak torque (Nm), power mean (W) and total work (J) of the affected joint in extension at 180º/sec, and in flexion at 240º/sec and 180º/sec.
Ultrasonography: Study of the synovial effusion degree (if any) measured in the longitudinal axis of the suprapatellar recess of the affected knee.Results are expressed as change from baseline in mm.
Time evolution of pain intensity as measured by Visual Analogue Scale (mm).
Questionnaire SF36-v2 to measure physical and mental health.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Events
secondary_outcome.description: The safety assessment includes a register of the appearance of adverse events along the 3 months of the study
Questionnaire to evaluate the subjective perception of the efficacy of the intervention.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in systolic blood pressure, hearth rate, general biochemical profile and body mass index at 3 months
secondary_outcome.description: Safety assessment includes an evaluation at 3 months of changes from baseline on systolic blood pressure, hearth rate, general biochemical profile and body mass index

arm_group.description: Subjects eating daily on yogurt supplemented with Mobilee
Subjects receiving daily a standard yogurt

intervention.description: One yogurt (125mL) per day including 80mg of Mobilee

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adult (between 20 and 70 years of age)
- Subject with low intensity knee gonalgia (VAS pain intensity between 3 and 5cm during at least the last 6 months)
- Healthy individual according to its medical records, physical and laboratorial parameters
- Positive informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Individuals requiring acetaminophen or any other drug to control pain
- Active rheumatoid arthritis or any other inflammatory joint disease
- Oral treatment with corticosteroids 4 weeks before selection
- Intra-articular treatment with corticosteroids 3 months before selection
- Significant injury of the study joint 12 months before selection
- Individuals receiving any drug or supplement for osteoarthritis
- Individuals requiring any type of medical prescription to control pain

overall_official.affiliation: Hospital Universitari Sant Joan de Reus

facility.name: Hospital Universitari Sant Joan de Reus
